urls.title: Hull & East Riding - CaBA
urls.description: Yorkshire Wildlife Trust 1 St. George's Place York YO24 1GN The CaBA Partnership for the Hull and East Riding management catchment was established in 2014. It is hosted by the Yorkshire Wildlife Trust with support f rom the East Yorkshire Rivers Trust as Joint Host. They are joined on the partnership by 13 other organisations that take an interest in the management and enhancement of the water bodies in the Hull and East Riding area. Prior to the national launch of CaBA, members of the partnership had a

urls.title: An introduction to Future Leaders
urls.description: Join us for this introduction to Future Leaders - a new initiative to promote and equip the next generation of leaders and influencers.

tweets.text:
Are your leaders ready for a carbon zero world?

Join us on Tues 9th March, 1pm for 'An introduction to Future Leaders'.

Speakers include: 
@McsCertified @EnvAgency @SustMeme @RichardCartlidg @Installermag
 
Book your spot now! https://t.co/Zf4bp16u5O

#carbonzero #futureleaders https://t.co/fVWKDAiFnV
@briscoe2015 @LDNWaterkeeper You've called us? We will no doubt look into it. Thanks, Julia. Peter

Our very first repair using 48 rock bags of 2000 kilo each. Thankfully, we had this crane to do the hard work for us.
It resulted in a solid repair (see comments).
Thanks @Rijkswaterstaat @EnvAgency @STOWAwater @Defensie @Vlaamsewaterweg @waterschap 
#climateadaptation #research https://t.co/EJjZHbJtEj

urls.title: Flood Risk Management Schemes | The Flood Hub
urls.description: Click on the t iles below to find out more information about the Proposed, In Progress or Completed Flood Risk Management Schemes across the North West. The information within these pages has been provided by the relevant Risk Management Authority and is hosted by The Flood Hub on this

tweets.text:
Did you know, that @TheFloodHub has all the latest details on #floodrisk management schemes across the #NorthWest?

Click the link below to get more info and check on #flood scheme progress ⬇️:
https://t.co/RMUcu2hKbt 

#ReducingFloodRisk @EnvAgencyNW #NWEngland https://t.co/hfZNeyYVNL

tweets.text: Our fantastic community volunteers have been busy monitoring the leaky dams @catchmentdesign  installed for @SCRiversTrust  above Staveley. Funded by @EnvAgency https://t.co/AsL72gFMhI

More sites are underway for the Banks and the Braches project. 

We are working with our partners @HolmeRiver and @treesponsibilit to deliver 20,605 trees, which will be planted across multiple sites in west Yorkshire. 

#Treeplanting #EAEnvironmentProgramme https://t.co/q4DPu823U6

My first public meeting tonight, re: Welsh Harp SSSI neglect.
Astounded at the doublespeak & circumlocution. 
Appalled at how much money is wasted. 
Angered at the lack of accountability by organisations in charge incl. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency 
Citizens must act and monitor. https://t.co/btZLt2rlPp

Thanks to a successful #fishery improvement prog bid to @EnvAgencyYNE with @WildTroutTrust + grant from @SandTCUKYorks, we fenced top of Hubberholme to protect both banks. Now, planting trees for shade & cover. Angler access improved. Roll on trout season https://t.co/QaUaVP33yk

We want to ensure water companies provide a sustainable supply of water to their customers, while protecting and enhancing the environment.

We've published guidelines for water companies to use for their water resources management plans.

Read them here: https://t.co/w60et6JxQ1 https://t.co/02C4xH5X65

📢 Today is the last day to complete the North West RFCC community survey! @EnvAgencyNW

Express your views on what aspects of #flooding & #coastal change matter most to you & what issues you think should be prioritised in their business plan refresh ➡️ 
 https://t.co/oOhvZRE5C9 https://t.co/Bns2scuBla

Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd has met with construction industry leaders to call for more investment in low-carbon infrastructure, highlighting the need for collaboration, courage & speed to keep pace with climate change: https://t.co/DrgZ2TRmEQ

@CBItweets @CommonsEAC #netzero https://t.co/Ahcs8CfpMM

@EnvAgencyMids The Council received more than 2,000 complaints about the odour at the weekend. We had officers out on the ground monitoring the situation and evidencing residents’ complaints until well past midnight on Saturday. We have colleagues living across the borough 👇 https://t.co/23UEiA70Su

urls.title: New figures show rise in fly-tipping incidents
urls.description: INCIDENTS of fly-tipping on public land have increased by two per cent across England in 2019/2020, according to new figures released by Defra on February 24.

tweets.text: New figures show rise in fly-tipping incidents @CLAsouthwest #flytipping @MidDevonDC @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @thealanquick #Crediton #Devon #farming #farminguk @MelJStride @DC_Police https://t.co/zKpu2FAtH7
@YWHelp @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @looknorthBBC Please bring tankers. All my neighbours have sewage coming up into their gardens and properties.... again.

@D7VYD @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @looknorthBBC I see you have spoken with us this morning and we have arranged for a visit.  The reference number for this case is U168117. I have added extra notes to this case as well.

Do you know where to report flooding? ☎️Reporting is different if it is from a main river (@EnvAgencyYNE), sewerage and mains (@nwater_care), or roads, gullies steams, Denes or Burns it is your local council.  #floodaware #floodfriday https://t.co/Mvc0DnJhxg

urls.title: Walleys Quarry Landfill Site - Latest Update - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
In response to increased community concerns of odour at Walleys Quarry in Silverdale #NewcastleUnderLyme & surrounding area we have installed this air quality monitoring unit off Galingale View.

Read more ➡️ https://t.co/o558iAVicn

#Staffordshire @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive https://t.co/BeeaGpjD6a

@YWHelp @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife North Newbald, Eastgate, Ings Beck. You've only attended nearly 200 times in the last 5 years only this time it is way, way out of hand. Human waste is coming out of the drains as we speak. @looknorthBBC

Do you want to learn about the different ways you can help marine life & the environment?

Join us 8th - 12th March @ 2pm for Waste Management, Ocean Detective Lessons & a live read!

Register now for the primary session: https://t.co/WzK8pbi5EN

@EnvAgency #saveourocean #BSW2021 https://t.co/60lBeOwInF

tweets.text: So pleased to see this fantastic project completed @beeswaxfarming working collaboratively with @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyMids looking forward to monitoring the benefits of this project 🐝 🐟🌱 #floodplain #landmanagement #environment #farming #landscape #collaboration https://t.co/SsLzXgHazo
@D7VYD @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife Hi Dai. Where are you seeing this? ^Steven

@YWHelp @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife please accept my apologies but here's a picture of a dead Water Vole - just in case anyone has any doubt about just how horrendous the raw sewage situation is in North Newbald right now. https://t.co/KbE7AGA18D

Works are progressing well on phase 2 of the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme

Here's a sneak peak of the new footpath in Bitts Park, near #CarlisleCastle. 

Are you looking forward to using this? 

#ReducingFloodRisk https://t.co/TrEnkYJhvO

@SimonTagg @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Ps Red Industries and @EnvAgencyMids are also taking on people who know about SEO. If they want reputational damage, they've got it. https://t.co/LdNfW7qLil
@SimonTagg @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids This is brilliant Simon, thank you for all your efforts.
@SimonTagg @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Such good news.  Maybe there’s light at the end of a very long tunnel!

urls.title: Climate crisis hitting 'worst case scenarios', warns Environment Agency
urls.description: Sir James Bevan says extreme flooding in UK indicates urgent need for change if humanity is to survive

tweets.text:
From ‘hitting worst-case scenario levels’ to a warning that this is ‘not science fiction’.  Another alarming call by Sir James Bevan, Chief Executive of @EnvAgency.   

The #ClimateEmergency can no longer be left unchecked: https://t.co/bhe6anoxFS #COP26

tweets.text:
It's a "flipping cold day" in east #Kent. You heard it here first...

Debbie out on two wheels at #Sandwich, checking for anything untoward - like debris in the #GreatStour. 

If YOU see any rubbish or blockages in our waterways, please call us: 0800 807060. https://t.co/Ehq7DFybif
